security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing TypeScript code examples for ShadCN UI and Framer Motion integration. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or external commands detected. Contains only documentation and code samples.

content.user_title: Build animated ShadCN UI components with Framer Motion
content.value_statement: Creating smooth animations for ShadCN UI components requires understanding Framer Motion patterns. This skill provides ready-to-use code patterns for fade-ins, hover effects, dialog animations, page transitions, and loading skeletons.
actual_capabilities: Create fade-in and fade-out animations for React components
Build animated lists with staggered transitions and exit animations
Implement page transitions with enter and exit effects
Add hover and tap effects to cards using spring physics
Create pulse animations for loading skeletons
Animate ShadCN Dialog components with scale and opacity effects
limitations: Does not provide pre-built components - only code patterns to copy
Does not include ShadCN installation or project setup automation
Does not handle complex animation state management beyond basic examples
No built-in accessibility checks for animated content

use_cases.title: Adding Animations to Dashboards
use_cases.description: Create engaging dashboard interfaces with animated cards, lists, and page transitions using ShadCN components.

use_cases.title: Prototyping Animated Interactions
use_cases.description: Rapidly prototype smooth animations for modal dialogs, hover states, and loading indicators in React projects.

use_cases.title: Enhancing User Interfaces
use_cases.description: Add professional polish to admin panels and content-heavy applications with minimal animation overhead.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Fade Animation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a fade-in animation for a React component using Framer Motion. Use 'use client' directive and animate opacity from 0 to 1 with a 0.3 second duration.

prompt_templates.title: Animated List
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an animated list component that shows items one by one using Framer Motion staggerChildren. Include AnimatePresence for exit animations on list items.

prompt_templates.title: Interactive Hover Card
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a hoverable card component that scales up slightly when hovered and scales down when tapped. Use spring transition with stiffness 300 and damping 20.

prompt_templates.title: Animated Dialog
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement an animated ShadCN Dialog that scales from 0.95 to 1.0 with opacity fade when opening. Use AnimatePresence to handle the exit animation.

output_examples.input: Create a button component with a loading skeleton animation
output: Use motion.div with animate prop set to opacity array [0.5, 1, 0.5]
Set transition duration to 1.5 seconds with repeat: Infinity
Apply bg-muted background color and rounded corners
Accept optional className prop for custom styling

best_practices: Always use 'use client' directive for Framer Motion components
Use AnimatePresence to properly unmount animated components with exit animations
Apply layout prop to motion elements for smooth reordering animations
anti_patterns: Avoid mixing multiple animation libraries in the same component
Do not animate expensive properties like filter or box-shadow excessively
Avoid removing 'use client' from components that use Framer Motion hooks

faq.question: Which React frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Next.js 15 App Router and any React project supporting 'use client' directive.

faq.question: What is the minimum Framer Motion version?
faq.answer: Requires Framer Motion v10 or later for all animation features to work correctly.

faq.question: Can these patterns work with custom components?
faq.answer: Yes, Framer Motion patterns apply to any React component, not just ShadCN components.

faq.question: Is any data stored or sent externally?
faq.answer: No, this skill is purely documentation-based with no network calls or data persistence.

faq.question: Why is my animation not rendering?
faq.answer: Ensure the component uses 'use client' and that Framer Motion is properly imported and installed.

faq.question: How does this compare to CSS animations?
faq.answer: Framer Motion provides declarative animations with physics-based springs, exit animations, and layout transitions that CSS cannot easily achieve.
